text: next to afghanistan the taliban have
ordered a new decree on women's rights
in the country an issue they've
obviously faced significant pressure on
from the international community among
other issues the statement addresses
marriage and says quote a woman's
consent is necessary and that no one can
force a woman to marry by coercion or
pressure it says a woman is not a
property but a noble and free human
being it also orders rights for widows
stating after the death of a husband no
one can marry a widow by force including
her relatives
but the order makes no mention of
employment rights or education the
decree comes as the taliban continue to
urge governments to release funds as
they grapple with a growing humanitarian
crisis
while pashtana durani is an activist and
co-founder of learn an afghan ngo
dedicated to education she gave her
reaction to the taliban's decree
any decree that
protects women rights is welcomed
as long as it does protect women act but
we all know that in afghanistan in a
country where it's always like you know
the marriage is not uh by constant
either of the girl or the boy in
majority of the cases so i wouldn't see
even if they issue the decree it's
barely going to get implemented but it
is welcomed that's the first thing the
second thing is um the marriage issue
comes later and it's not a crisis right
now so i don't understand why did they
have to go for something which is not a
crisis but girls not in school women out
of the workforce is a crisis right now
and that is sending the country into
crisis why are they not uh replying to
that and why are they not responding to
that that makes me question or maybe
they just want to play mind games
because uh when they issue this degree
it doesn't alienate their food soldiers
but at the same time they are trying to
make good with the international
community now thanks to push down that
durani there
